description: Async, please join only if you play during American continental daytime and can do 2+ Moves/Day, it's Alpha and Prototype and can break
title: 1877: Stockholm Tramways

actions.message: Gl hf!
Welcome everyone, thanks for joining, let's kick the tires of this Alpha game, sounds promising.  I know that Bellmaker already took it for a spin, what's your impression?
GLHF
thanks
I'm totally new to it, so I am looking forward to it
The async auction is going to be slow unfortunately, but afterwards it should pick up pace
From what I can tell, the one pitfall to watch out for is the hostile takeover
I saw a completed game where one did not pay attention to that possibility and was not amused...
ANother quirk is the town tiles being not straight (except for C towns)
Mix of 62 and Ireland? Stock jumps are large so pump and dump seems strong
Parring high is riskier than usual

auto_actions.reason: cheesinglee bought on corporation RF and is unsecure

actions.message: Bellmaker, I should have heeded your initial advice, I see now why you want to par low and take advantage of those jumps, and I also see that not all strassenbahns are made equal, I chose the one in the poorest part of town it seems
so far I have a positive first impression, nothing unique or revolutionary that I can tell unlike say TOP 1871, but good pacing, good train roster, and tight map, it moves along at a brisk pace
seems like TSSL should have had the option to acquire D
Hmm
oh, I misread this condition: "the president of the acquiring company holds more shares of the two companies than all other players do together."
I thought I just needed to own more than any other player
Ah

Indeed after this first play I realize that I did not try to exploit the mergers as hostile takeovers and I think that might be the more profitable way to use them since friendly mergers resulted in great share value dilution
And yes, you need a lot of shares first hostile takeover...
*for a

So I was thinking about this, and assuming that everyone goes for at least 6 shares in the companies where they are president, the only ways to do a hostile takeover are either when nobody other than the acquiring president buys at least one share in the merging companies or when the one doing the hostile takeover takes a risk and buys more than one share in the acquired company, both seem to be a rare or risky gambit, am I missing some other scenario?
And of course one consequence of this is that it encourages owning 6 rather than 5 shares to better insulate from takeovers
Just thinking out loud, after all it's a prototype and I am trying to see what is and isn't possible

I don't think owning more than 1 share is a risk if your goal is to end up owning the company. If your company goes first in operating order, you can effect the merger before the defending president can drain their company of its assets

I am also curious to see why the designer chose to reserve some companies for later and how much they affect the current gamestate. As far as setting, theme, and historical notes the game seems very spot on, it really feels like it is described in the historical notes.
Well played cheesinglee.
a strong victory
If I see this right, you parred at 70 your first corp, then merged it right away with a similarly low parred company
oh wow, the force buy rules are way harsher than I thought
thanks luigi, that appears to be what I did, but I can't claim to have planned any of this out.
I always lose the same way, I never seem to learn, I make companies that can survive by merging them and in so doing I fall behind in number of shares owned, chesinglee you have double what I have
I have to figure out how to stop doing that
I'll play 1877 again, I am curious to see how it is with one game under the belt
GG I dont get why I couldnt take over D at the start of 9.1
I had 10 shares of the two companies which was clearly more than everyone else
@bellmaker I think it's because the number of hexes where the two companies had a station was more than 6
Since this past now is automatic, with no player's input,  feel free to master mode for me
*phase, not past
@luigicool well thats silly, something to keep in mind
The token thing
I agree, it's one of those rules that will be easily overlooked until it happens and never forgotten once it happens, I can see why the designer does it but I wish it would be more visible
go ahead and master mode my runs too
Impressive job @cheesinglee!
good game!
